segments.text: Hello and welcome to the Saturday Shot Tip episode and in today's video we are going to
bind this FSIA6B receiver to the transmitter. So for this purpose you need an ESC and a battery
to power the receiver and a bind key. The bind key actually activates the bind state of the
receiver so you have to plug the bind key into the last port of the receiver that is actually B-VCC.
It is actually used for input power and binding. The B represents the bind so you have to plug this
key into the last port and then you just have to take the BEC wire of the ESC which is actually the
to input power for to the receiver and plug it in any of the port of the receiver. Make sure that the
the signal wire the white wire is towards the facing upwards upwards toward towards you. So and then
lastly just plug the battery into the ESC. So the light in the receiver which will start blinking which
actually represents that it is in bind mode. So now here come the turn of the transmitter and in
transmitter you actually have got a bind key. Here it is written bind key. In some of the receiver for
example FST6 the bind key is just at the back side of the transmitter. So before turning on the transmitter
put all the switches up the throttle down and press the bind key and then turn on the transmitter. So it
will show binding rx and it is bound and here it will show the voltage of the receiver which is 4.9 volts
and the signal of the receiver and the light on the receiver will stop blinking which shows that the
receiver is bound to the transmitter. About the bind key of the transmitter I actually carry my bind key in my
keys. Actually I am mostly around the airplanes or receiver's binding so I keep it with me and my keys. You have these keys with your transmitter and
it's your choice. So that's what that was all about today's video. Thank you and stay tuned.
